item.title: Covid in Sydney: Military deployed to help enforce lockdown
item.description: Authorities say the deployment is needed, but critics argue it will "pick on" marginalised groups.

item.title: Covid-19: Biden tells states to offer $100 vaccine incentive as cases rise
item.description: The US president also announced that all federal workers must be vaccinated or subjected to testing.

item.title: US sailor charged over massive USS Bonhomme warship blaze in 2020
item.description: More than 60 people were injured, and the $1bn USS Bonhomme Richard had to be scrapped.

item.title: Coronavirus: Israel to give third jab to people aged over 60
item.description: It will be the first country to offer such a Covid booster amid a recent surge in infections.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Didi: Chinese ride-hailing giant denies plans to go private
item.description: Didi shares surged by almost 50% in pre-market trade after a report that it planned to go private.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson sues Disney over streaming of Black Widow
item.description: The star says box office takings for Black Widow were hit when it was streamed at the same time.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Fighting escalates despite ceasefire
item.description: Forces in Amhara are battling rebels on three fronts along the border with Tigray, officials say.

item.title: Daphne Caruana Galizia: Malta responsible for journalist death - inquiry
item.description: The results of an inquiry say officials could have prevented Daphne Caruana Galizia's 2017 murder.

item.title: First group of evacuated Afghan interpreters to arrive in US
item.description: The evacuations are part of Operation Allies Refuge as the US military mission in Afghanistan ends.

item.title: Johnny Ventura: Dominican merengue legend dies aged 81
item.description: The Dominican Republic singer, whose career spanned six decades, is seen as a Latin music legend.

item.title: China warns UK as carrier strike group approaches
item.description: A fleet of British ships is currently sailing through the South China Sea en route to Japan.

item.title: Covid and a coup: The double crisis pushing Myanmar to the brink
item.description: A surge in virus cases has dealt a fresh blow to a country already dealing with military coup.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 23-29 July 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: 'My bakery lets you take a bite out of celebs'
item.description: Funny Face Bakery shot to fame when Kris Jenner and Kim Kardashian posted about its cookies.

item.title: South Africa riots: The inside story of Durban's week of anarchy
item.description: The worst unrest since white-minority rule ended has left deep scars, especially in the coastal city of Durban.

item.title: The separated refugees brought back together by judo
item.description: Sanda Aldass and Muna Dahouk have trained together since childhood but the war in Syria separated them.

item.title: Covid vaccines: Tourists head to the US to get vaccinated
item.description: Some tourists are spending thousands of dollars to travel to the US to get a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Petrol bombs thrown at Cuban embassy in Paris
item.description: Cuba's foreign ministry has released surveillance footage of the attack at its embassy in France.

item.title: Capitol Hill police officer in tears during testimony
item.description: Officer Gonell gave an emotional statement during the first day of the US Capitol riot inquiry.

item.title: Lebanonâ€™s descent into darkness
item.description: The country's economic crisis has forced some families to move into refugee camps to survive.

item.title: Dressage: How to make a horse dance
item.description: For some, it's an oddity to watch only at the Olympics... for others, it's a lifetime of training.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Novak Djokovic thrashes Kei Nishikori to reach men's semi-finals
item.description: Novak Djokovic remains on course for a 'Golden Slam' after thrashing home hope Kei Nishikori to ease into the Olympic semi-finals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Simone Biles reacts to support for withdrawal from team and all-around finals
item.description: US gymnast Simone Biles reacts to the widespread support she has received after withdrawing from Thursday's all-around final.

item.title: Rowers win Ireland's first gold
item.description: Ireland win their first gold medal of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games as Paul O'Donovan and Fintan McCarthy claim the lightweight men's double sculls.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How to think like a champion
item.description: Newsbeat speaks to Bill Beswick, the psychologist behind the 26-year-old breaststroke star.
